contents.value:
New Group Maths Test
Linear Test B 2A - Trial
Listen carefully to my instructions.
I am going to show you six easy questions so you can practise before the test begins.
If you have any trouble answering these questions, ask your teacher for help before starting the test.
Practice 1
Daniel has six pieces of homework. He completes four pieces.
How many pieces of homework does Daniel have left?
Answer
Practice 2
Which of these shapes has three sides?
Practice 3
Which of these shapes have the same number of sides?
Practice 4
Put these numbers in order from the smallest to the largest.
Practice 5
Match the words to the correct numbers.
Practice 6
Shade 12 of the circle.
This is the end of the practice questions. You are now ready to start the test.
Make sure you have everything you need before you begin. You will need a pen, or pencil, and some paper. Calculators should not be used in this test.
Please wait until your teacher tells you to begin the test and then click the �Start Test� button.
If you want to move back and forth during the test, use the back and forward buttons at the bottom of your screen.
Start Test

What is six plus three?
Give your answer using numbers only.
Answer
Choose three numbers to complete the addition sum.
?  +  ?  +  ?  = 21
Each number can only be used once.
Match each division sum to the correct answer.
Put these numbers in order, from smallest to largest.
Which option describes this number sequence?
Use only these numbers to make a correct number sentence.
Here is a number line.
What number is the arrow pointing to?
Answer
Which part of this cube has been shaded in?
Here is a pattern of shapes.
Which set of shapes would continue this pattern?
Which container is holding 50ml of water?
Here are four sentences about fractions.
Which sentence is correct?
Match the number sentences that have the same answer.

Here are three different number sequences.
One number is missing from each sequence.
22  24  26  28   ?   32  34
21  24  27   ?   33  36  39
25   ?   35  40  45  50  55
What is the missing number?
Answer
Which number sentence is correct?
Which of these statements about the 5 times table is true?

choices.text: All numbers in the 5 times table end in 0 or 5.
All numbers in the 5 times are odd.
All numbers in the 5 times are in the 10 times table.

contents.value: Fill in the next 3 numbers in this sequence.
Match each word with the correct number.
Complete this addition sum.
Choose the clock that is 60 minutes ahead of this clock.
Match each measurement to the correct unit.

Ali has a games board. She has a counter on space number 7.
Ali moves her counter up two spaces.
Ali then moves her counter right one space.
Which space number will Ali�s counter finish on?
Answer
What fraction of each fruit has been chosen.
Match each picture to the correct fraction.
Fill in the missing numbers in these three number sentences.
Joseph thinks 33 + 58 = 91.
Choose the number sentence which proves that Joseph is right.

Jessica has 9 bags of pears.
Each bag contains 5 pears.
How many pears does Jessica have altogether?
Answer
pears
Match the number sentences that have the same answer.
What is the missing number in this addition sum?

Jar A holds 74 sweets.
Jar B holds half as many sweets as Jar A.
How many sweets does Jar B hold?
Answer
sweets
This table shows the number of cars that were washed each day.
How many more cars were washed on Tuesday than Wednesday?
Answer
cars

Peter has 36 sweets.
He eats 14 of them.
How many sweets does he eat?
Answer
sweets
This is the end of the test.
If you have time, re-check your answers and make sure you are happy with them.
To finish the test and submit your answers, click the �End Test� button.
End Test
